messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/v1/media` with method GET, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/MediaController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\MediaController@store` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/media` with HTTP method GET.

2. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/MediaController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\MediaController@index` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/media` with HTTP method GET.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a dict of Response Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].responses) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the dict of Response Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Explanation:

I inspected the code for the GET /v1/media endpoint. The route registry shows the index action is publicly accessible (routes/api.php). The controller method index in App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\MediaController returns a ResourceCollection built from MediaResource::collection(MediaLibrary::first()->media()->paginate($request->input('limit', 20))). The Media resource (App\Http\Resources\Media) serializes each media item to an object with fields: id, name, url, thumb_url.

Because a Laravel ResourceCollection wrapping a paginator produces the standard Laravel pagination JSON (top-level keys: data (array of resource items), links (first/last/prev/next), and meta (current_page, from, last_page, links [array], path, per_page, to, total)), I constructed a Swagger 2.0-style response schema describing that structure. I included:

- 200 response: description and a schema for the paginated collection:
  - data: array of media objects (id, name, url, thumb_url)
  - links: object with first, last, prev, next (URI strings; prev/next can be null at page boundaries)
  - meta: object with pagination metadata (current_page, from, last_page, links array of {url,label,active}, path, per_page, to, total)

- default response: a generic unexpected error object with a message string.

I avoided using $ref and kept the schema inline as requested.

the final generated result begins
{"200":{"description":"A paginated list of media resources.","schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"data":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"id":{"type":"integer","format":"int64"},"name":{"type":"string"},"url":{"type":"string","format":"uri"},"thumb_url":{"type":"string","format":"uri"}},"required":["id","name","url","thumb_url"]}},"links":{"type":"object","properties":{"first":{"type":"string","format":"uri"},"last":{"type":"string","format":"uri"},"prev":{"type":"string","format":"uri"},"next":{"type":"string","format":"uri"}}},"meta":{"type":"object","properties":{"current_page":{"type":"integer","format":"int32"},"from":{"type":"integer","format":"int32"},"last_page":{"type":"integer","format":"int32"},"links":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"url":{"type":"string","format":"uri"},"label":{"type":"string"},"active":{"type":"boolean"}},"required":["label","active"]}},"path":{"type":"string","format":"uri"},"per_page":{"type":"integer","format":"int32"},"to":{"type":"integer","format":"int32"},"total":{"type":"integer","format":"int32"}}},"required":["data","links","meta"]}},"default":{"description":"Unexpected error","schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"message":{"type":"string"}}}}}
